text: - I'm Andrew Wojszynski.

I lead the Solutions
Engineering Team at Wiz.
Generative AI

is already impacting the
cybersecurity industry,
really in two main ways.
First, through AI-powered security
and then through security of AI.

So with AI-powered security,
what we found is that

AI is assisting
cybersecurity practitioners
in applying their domain knowledge,
not in ways of writing queries
through languages like Yara or Rego,

but really applying their
domain knowledge to fixing risks
rather than spending time writing queries.
Now, secondarily,
we find that over 70% of organizations
are already using AI services.
This is information
gathered by our Wiz Threat Research Team.

This is faster adoption than
Kubernetes was five years ago.
It's already reached a critical mass point
across the enterprise.

These are services that
require new ways of security.
The biggest misconception

is that Gen AI is
something to be afraid of.
It's really not.
It's something to be embraced
and something that is here
to make our lives ultimately easier.
So rather than spending time

working through tons and
tons of data to find answers,

we can use automations
through generative AI
to find those answers more quickly.
It's not something to be afraid of,
it's something to embrace.

AWS helps my software
company be more scalable.

Without AWS, we would not be
able to reach the customers
that we reach today
and ultimately deliver the value
that we're able to deliver today.
(upbeat music)
